greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: The number of solutions to x^2 + y^2 + 2*z^2 = n in nonnegative integers x,y,z.
comment: Also, the number of 4X4 matrices composed of squares of integers, symmetric under 90 degree rotation, with all rows summing to n. Such matrices have the form:
formula: G.f.: (1 + theta_3(q))^2*(1 + theta_3(q^2))/8, where theta_3() is the Jacobi theta function. - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Aug 01 2018
results.author: _R. H. Hardin_ Feb 09 2009
ext: More general definition from _Max Alekseyev_, Sep 29 2012
